body:
Streak yeast cell EGY48 with p8op-lacZ reporter plasmid on SD-Ura plate for 3-5 days \(at 30 <sup>o</sup>C). Scrape an entire colony \(2-3 mm in diameter) into 1 ml of YPD medium, Vortex vigorously to disperse any clumps. Transfer this into a flask containing YPD:
  Small Scale: 50 ml in 250 ml flask


Library Scale: 150 ml in 500 ml flask





Incubate at 30 <sup>o</sup>C overnight \(16-18 hr) with shaking \(at 250 rpm) to stationary phase \(OD<sub>600</sub> greater than/equal to 1.5).

Early the next morning, transfer overnight culture \(enough to produce an OD<sub>600</sub>=0.2-0.3) into this volume of YPD:
  Small Scale: 300 ml in 1L flask


Library Scale: 1000 ml in 2L flask
Incubate at 30 <sup>o</sup>C for 3 hr with shaking \(230 rpm). The OD<sub>600</sub> will be 0.5 plus/minus 0.1.
Place cells in 50-ml tubes and centrifuge at 1500 rpm in floor centrifuge for 5 min at room temperature.

Discard the supernatant and resuspend cell pellets by vortexing in this volume of sterile TE or H<sub>2</sub>O:
  Small Scale: 25-50 ml


Library Scale: 500 ml
Pool cells in 50 ml tube and centrifuge at 1500 rpm in floor centrifuge for 5 min at room temperature.
Decant the supernatant.

Resuspend the cell pellet in this volume of freshly prepared, sterile 1xTE/LiAc:
  Small Scale: 1.5 ml


Library Scale: 8 ml


  


\(NOTE: Cells must be used within about an hour after preparation.)

Prepare PEG/LiAc solution, and this solution will be used in step #12:
  Small Scale: 10ml


Library Scale: 100ml

Add the following to each tube and mix:
  Small scale \(in 1.5 ml eppt tube) 


Library scale \(in 500 ml centrifuge tube)


        


Bait vector- 0.2 ug \(small), 0.6 mg \(library)


Library vector- 0.1 ug \(small), 0.3 mg \(library)


Herring testes carrier DNA- 0.1 mg \(small), 20 mg \(library)





\(For simultaneous cotransfection, a molar ratio of 2:1 \(Bait vector: Prey vector) is recommended). \(Just prior to use, denature the carrier DNA by placing it in a boiling water for 20 min and immediately cooling it on ice)

Add this volume of yeast competent cells to each tube and mix well by vortexing:
  Small Scale: 0.1 ml


Library Scale: 8 ml

Add sterile PEG/LiAc solution \(made in step #9) to each tube and vortex at high speed to mix:
  Small Scale: 0.6 ml


Library Scale: 60 ml
Incubate at 30 <sup>o</sup>C for 30 min with shaking \(200 rpm).

Add this volume of DMSO:
  Small Scale: 70 ul


Library Scale: 7 ml





Mix well by gentle inversion or swirling. Do not Vortex.
Heat shock for 15 min in a 42 <sup>o</sup>C water bath. Swirl occasionally to mix \(large- and library-scale only)
Chill cells on ice for 1-2 min.

Centrifuge cells for:  
  Small Scale: 5 sec., room temperature - 14K rpm


Library Scale: 5 min., room temperature - 1500 rpm
Remove the supernatant.

Resuspend cells in this volume of 1 x TE:
  Small Scale: 0.5 ml


Library Scale: 10 ml

Plating:
   For Small-scale cotransformation: spread 200 ul per 100-mm SD-Ura-His-Trp.


 For large- and library-scale transformation:


--- Spread 100 ul of a 1:1,000, 1:100, and 1:10 dilution on SD-Ura-His-Trp plates \(100 mm) for cotransformation efficiency controls.


--- Spread 1 ul \(diluted in 100 ul of H<sub>2</sub>O) on SD-His-Ura and SD-Trp-Ura plates \(100 mm) to check the transformation efficiency of each plasmid. 


--- Spread the remaining transformation suspension on SD-Ura-His-Trp plates \(200 ul per 150-mm Plates)


 Incubate the plates at 30 <sup>o</sup>C for 3-5 days.

Calculating cotransformation efficiency and number of clones amplified:
  


A.      Cotransformation efficiency:  count the colonies \(cfu) growing on the SD-His-Trp-Ura dilution plate that has 30-300 cfu.


     


cfu/ug DNA = \(Cfu x total suspension vol. \(ul)) / 


             \(\(Vol. Plated \(ul)) x \(dilution factor) x \(amount.DNA used\(ug)\(Limiting plasmid)))





B. The number of clones amplified:


cfu/ug x amt. Of library plasmid used \(cfu/ug) = # of clones amplified.
